org.datavec.arrow

Class ArrowConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.datavec.arrow.ArrowConverter

  • public class ArrowConverter
extends java.lang.Object
    Interop between datavec primitives and arrow. This allows for datavec schemas and primitives to be converted to the arrow format.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ArrowConverter()

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArrowConverter

        public ArrowConverter()

    • Method Detail

      • toArray

        public static INDArray toArray(ArrowWritableRecordTimeSeriesBatch arrowWritableRecordBatch)
        Create an ndarray from a matrix. The included batch must be all the same number of rows in order to work. The reason for this is INDArray must be all the same dimensions. Note that the input columns must also be numerical. If they aren't numerical already, consider using an TransformProcess to transform the data output from ArrowRecordReader in to the proper format for usage with this method for direct conversion.
        Parameters:
        arrowWritableRecordBatch - the incoming batch. This is typically output from an ArrowRecordReader
        Returns:
        an INDArray representative of the input data

      • toArray

        public static INDArray toArray(ArrowWritableRecordBatch arrowWritableRecordBatch)
        Create an ndarray from a matrix. The included batch must be all the same number of rows in order to work. The reason for this is INDArray must be all the same dimensions. Note that the input columns must also be numerical. If they aren't numerical already, consider using an TransformProcess to transform the data output from ArrowRecordReader in to the proper format for usage with this method for direct conversion.
        Parameters:
        arrowWritableRecordBatch - the incoming batch. This is typically output from an ArrowRecordReader
        Returns:
        an INDArray representative of the input data

      • setValue

        public static void setValue(ColumnType columnType,
                            org.apache.arrow.vector.FieldVector fieldVector,
                            java.lang.Object value,
                            int row)
        Set the value of the specified column vector at the specified row based on the given value. The value will be converted relative to the specified column type. Note that the passed in value may only be a Writable or a String
        Parameters:
        columnType - the column type of the value
        fieldVector - the field vector to set
        value - the value to set (Writable or String types)
        row - the row of the item
